{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Hickory Woodlot: Add two green mana to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Hickory Woodlot, sacrifice it.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.
cards.flavor: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.

rulings.text: Once you announce that you're casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, players can't try to tap your lands to stop you from paying.

{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Acidic Dagger
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Whenever target creature deals combat damage to a non-Wall creature this turn, destroy that non-Wall creature. When the targeted creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Acidic Dagger. Activate this ability only before blockers are declared.

rulings.text: Acidic Dagger does not affect the creature if all damage is prevented or redirected.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the Declare Blockers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Destroy any non-Wall creature receiving combat damage from target creature this turn. If targeted creature leaves play, bury Acidic Dagger. Use this ability only before defense is chosen.

cards.name: Amber Prison
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step.
{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Amber Prison remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap phase.
{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. As long as Amber Prison remains tapped, that permanent does not untap during its controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Amulet of Unmaking
cards.text: {5}, {T}, Exile Amulet of Unmaking: Exile target artifact, creature, or land. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
Trade to trade, not to keep.
—Suq'Ata motto

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {5}, {T}, Remove Amulet of Unmaking from the game: Remove target artifact, creature, or land from the game. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Basalt Golem
cards.text:
Basalt Golem can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Whenever Basalt Golem becomes blocked by a creature, that creature's controller sacrifices it at end of combat. If the player does, they create a 0/2 colorless Wall artifact creature token with defender.

rulings.text: The token creature is put onto the battlefield at the end of combat only if the blocking creature is sacrificed during the resolution of the triggered ability.

cards.originalText:
Basalt Golem cannot be blocked by artifact creatures.
Whenever Basalt Golem is blocked by any creature, bury that creature at end of combat and put a Stone token into play under the control of the creature's controller. Treat this token as a 0/2 artifact creature that counts as a Wall.

cards.name: Bone Mask
cards.text: {2}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Exile cards from the top of your library equal to the damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor:
"The protection offered comes at a price. How numerous are your kin?"
—Purraj of Urborg

rulings.text: If you do not have enough cards in your library, the damage is still prevented and all the cards in your library are exiled.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Prevent all damage to you from any one source. For each 1 damage prevented in this way, remove the top card of your library from the game.

cards.name: Charcoal Diamond
cards.text:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
cards.originalText:
Charcoal Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Chariot of the Sun
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains flying and has base toughness 1.
cards.flavor:
"Sun follows Moon until she tires, then carries her until she's strong / and runs ahead of him again."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: The entire effect lasts until end of turn, not just the toughness reduction.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature you control gains flying and has its toughness reduced to 1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Crystal Golem
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, Crystal Golem phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"Once, a wealthy king commissioned an artificial creature to be crafted from the royal treasury, thinking it a clever ploy to have the jewels guard themselves."
—Azeworai, "The Golem's Wish"
cards.originalText: At end of your turn, Crystal Golem phases out.

cards.name: Cursed Totem
cards.text: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
Pass me from soul to soul / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

rulings.text: Cursed Totem does not prevent creature cards which are not on the battlefield from having their abilities activated.
Cursed Totem can prevent mana abilities from being activated.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: Players cannot play any creature abilities requiring an activation cost.

cards.name: Elixir of Vitality
cards.text:
Elixir of Vitality enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Elixir of Vitality: You gain 4 life.
{8}, {T}, Sacrifice Elixir of Vitality: You gain 8 life.
cards.flavor:
"Eternal life or your money back."
—Unnamed Suq'Ata merchant, deceased
cards.originalText:
Elixir of Vitality comes into play tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Elixir of Vitality: Gain 4 life.
{8}, {T}, Sacrifice Elixir of Vitality: Gain 8 life.

cards.name: Ersatz Gnomes
cards.text:
{T}: Target spell becomes colorless.
{T}: Target permanent becomes colorless until end of turn.
cards.flavor: From jungle to sea, from sea to stone, from stone to field, from field to bone. What am I? —Zhalfirin riddle

rulings.text: If Ersatz Gnomes targets a spell that becomes a permanent, the permanent will enter the battlefield colorless and will remain colorless until it leaves the battlefield (or until another effect changes its color).

cards.originalText:
{T}: Target spell is colorless. Play this ability as an interrupt.
{T}: Target permanent is colorless until end of turn.

cards.name: Fire Diamond
cards.text:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
cards.originalText:
Fire Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Grinning Totem
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles their library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: You may choose to find any kind of card, including a land. You must exile a card (unless the opponent's library is empty); you can't fail to find anything.

"Until the beginning of your next upkeep" means the effect wears off as soon as your next upkeep starts. Your last chance to play the card is usually the End step of the player who immediately precedes you.

The exiled card is played using the normal rules for timing and priority for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions. You'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for any card and put it face up in front of you. That player shuffles his or her library afterwards. You may play the card as though it were in your hand. If you do not play the card by the beginning of your next upkeep, put it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Horrible Hordes
cards.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor: Few are able to underestimate the hordes.
cards.originalText: Rampage 1 (For each creature assigned to block it beyond the first, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Igneous Golem
cards.text: {2}: Igneous Golem gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The creature rose from the mountain, its body weeping fire."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: {2}: Trample until end of turn

cards.name: Lead Golem
cards.text: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: Slow and heavy swings the club.
cards.originalText: If Lead Golem attacks, it does not untap during your next untap phase.

cards.name: Lion's Eye Diamond
cards.text: Discard your hand, Sacrifice Lion's Eye Diamond: Add three mana of any one color. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.
cards.flavor:
Held in the lion's eye
—Zhalfirin saying meaning "caught in the moment of crisis"

rulings.text: The ability is a mana ability, so it is activated and resolves as a mana ability, but it can only be activated at times when you can cast an instant. Yes, this is a bit weird.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Lion's Eye Diamond, Discard your hand: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Mana Prism
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source. {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Mangara's Tome
cards.text:
When Mangara's Tome enters the battlefield, search your library for five cards, exile them in a face-down pile, and shuffle that pile. Then shuffle your library.
{2}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead put the top card of the exiled pile into its owner's hand.

rulings.text: The ability is a replacement effect that replaces a draw.
If there are no cards left, you can still use the ability to turn a draw into a "do nothing".

cards.originalText:
When Mangara's Tome comes into play, search your library and choose any five cards. Shuffle these cards and put them face down under Mangara's Tome. Shuffle your library afterwards.
If you lose control of Mangara's Tome, remove all cards under it from the game.
{2}: Instead of drawing a card, put the top card from under Mangara's Tome into your hand.

cards.name: Marble Diamond
cards.text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
cards.originalText:
Marble Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Misers' Cage
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has five or more cards in hand, Misers' Cage deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Let him be imprisoned while his possessions wander free."
—Suq'Ata legal decree

rulings.text: It affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: At end of target opponent's upkeep, if that player has five or more cards in hand, Misers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Moss Diamond
cards.text:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.originalText:
Moss Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Patagia Golem
cards.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.
cards.originalText: {3}: Flying until end of turn

cards.name: Paupers' Cage
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Paupers' Cage deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: A cage may keep you in, but it does not keep the stones out.
cards.originalText: At end of target opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Paupers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Phyrexian Dreadnought
cards.text:
Trample
When Phyrexian Dreadnought enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice any number of creatures with total power 12 or greater.

rulings.text: The sacrifices are simultaneous, not one at a time.
Phasing in does not trigger "enters the battlefield" abilities, so you don't have to sacrifice again if it phases in.
Reverted to its original wording, this now has an enters-the-battlefield triggered ability. During resolution of the triggered ability, you choose one option or the other.
If the Dreadnought is no longer on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves, you may still choose either option.
If you are unable to sacrifice 12 power worth of creatures, then you cannot choose that option; in that case, you must sacrifice Phyrexian Dreadnought.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Phyrexian Dreadnought comes into play, sacrifice any number of creatures with total power of 12 or more, or bury Phyrexian Dreadnought.

cards.name: Phyrexian Vault
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

cards.name: Razor Pendulum
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player has 5 or less life, Razor Pendulum deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Amazing thing, gravity. It seems to work every time."
—Telim'Tor
cards.originalText: At the end of each player's turn, if that player has 5 or less life, Razor Pendulum deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Sand Golem
cards.text: When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Sand Golem, return Sand Golem from your graveyard to the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText: If a spell or effect controlled by an opponent causes you to discard Sand Golem, put Sand Golem from your graveyard into play at end of turn with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Sky Diamond
cards.text:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
cards.originalText:
Sky Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Teeka's Dragon
cards.text: Flying; trample; rampage 4 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +4/+4 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.originalText:
Flying, trample; rampage 4 (For each creature assigned to block it beyond the first, this creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.)
Teeka's Dragon counts as a Dragon.

cards.name: Telim'Tor's Darts
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Telim'Tor's Darts deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"People laughed at my darts—once."
—Telim'Tor
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Telim'Tor's Darts deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Unerring Sling
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Unerring Sling deals damage equal to the tapped creature's power to target attacking or blocking creature with flying.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Unerring Sling deals an amount of damage equal to that creature's power to target attacking or blocking creature with flying.

cards.name: Ventifact Bottle
cards.text:
{X}{1}, {T}: Put X charge counters on Ventifact Bottle. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, if Ventifact Bottle has a charge counter on it, tap it and remove all charge counters from it. Add {C} for each charge counter removed this way.
cards.originalText:
{1}{X}, {T}: Put X charge counters on Ventifact Bottle. Play this ability as a sorcery.
At the beginning of your main phase, if Ventifact Bottle has any charge counters on it, tap Ventifact Bottle and remove all charge counters from it to add to your mana pool an amount of colorless mana equal to the number of charge counters removed.

cards.name: Abyssal Hunter
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.
cards.flavor: Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.

rulings.text: The ability can target an already tapped creature.

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals to that creature an amount of damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power.

cards.name: Ashen Powder
cards.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard into play under your control.

cards.name: Barbed-Back Wurm
cards.text: {B}: Target green creature blocking Barbed-Back Wurm gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Mwonvuli Jungle has given the darkness teeth for tearing the gift of life from the weak."
—Jolrael
cards.originalText: {B}: Target green creature blocking Barbed-Back Wurm gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Binding Agony
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, Binding Agony deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor:
A crash of rhinos in my head
—Femeref expression meaning
"a severe head pain"
cards.originalText: For each 1 damage dealt to enchanted creature, Binding Agony deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Blighted Shaman
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{T}, Sacrifice a swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bone Harvest
cards.text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Only fools believe they will face my armies but once."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: You have to show which creature cards you put on top of your library, but not the order you put them there.

cards.originalText:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Breathstealer
cards.text: {B}: Breathstealer gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"As a child, I slept with a cloth over my face, to hide from the spirits that might pull the air from my lungs."
—Mosi, Femeref weaver
cards.originalText: {B}: +1/-1 until end of turn

cards.name: Cadaverous Knight
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}{B}: Regenerate Cadaverous Knight.
cards.flavor:
Grieve for the soul in death dishonored.
—Shadow Guild saying
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}{B}: Regenerate

cards.name: Carrion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Create X 0/1 black Insect creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
cards.flavor: King or herder, the maggots care not.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Put into play a number of Maggot tokens equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Treat these tokens as 0/1 black creatures.

cards.name: Catacomb Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Catacomb Dragon becomes blocked by a nonartifact, non-Dragon creature, that creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is half the creature's power, rounded down.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Catacomb Dragon is blocked by any nonartifact, non-Dragon creature, that creature's power is halved, rounded up, until end of turn.

cards.name: Choking Sands
cards.text: Destroy target non-Swamp land. If that land was nonbasic, Choking Sands deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
cards.flavor:
"The people wiped the sand from their eyes and cursed—and left the barren land to the hyenas and vipers."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonswamp land. If that land is a nonbasic land, Choking Sands deals 2 damage to the land's controller.

cards.name: Crypt Cobra
cards.text: Whenever Crypt Cobra attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

rulings.text: The player gets a poison counter as a triggered ability on not blocking the Cobra. Killing the Cobra after declaring blockers or preventing its damage will not prevent the poison counter.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Crypt Cobra attacks and is not blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. If any player has ten or more poison counters, he or she loses the game.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Femeref was guided by the wisdom of the Council of Voices. But in one terrible instant, they were slain, leaving Asmira as the sole voice of leadership."
—Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.originalText: Bury target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor:
"The ceremony ended with a voice from the shadows, a voice with vast, ominous power."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dirtwater Wraith
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{B}: Dirtwater Wraith gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The foul entities of the Uuserk swamp had never before dared to spread their influence to the very heart of Zhalfir."
—Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk (If defending player controls any swamps, this creature is unblockable.)
{B}: +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

cards.originalText: For each {B} you spend in addition to the casting cost, Drain Life deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Gain 1 life for each 1 damage dealt, but not more than the toughness of the creature or the life total of the player Drain Life damages.

cards.name: Dread Specter
cards.text: Whenever Dread Specter blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
Whatever follows life is incurable.
—Zhalfirin aphorism
cards.originalText: Whenever Dread Specter blocks or is blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Ebony Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
• Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
• Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

rulings.text: It targets the cards in the graveyard. These targets are selected when casting the spell.

cards.originalText: Choose one Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life; or remove from the game up to three cards in any player's graveyard; or target creature cannot be blocked this turn except by artifact or black creatures.

cards.name: Enfeeblement
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
cards.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"The night stalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Fetid Horror
cards.text: {B}: Fetid Horror gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Of the six who went down the Uuserek Trail to scout ahead, one returned. She clawed at her eyes and nostrils and sobbed with horror. I was curious about what she saw, but we chose another path."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal
cards.originalText: {B}: +1/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Forbidden Crypt
cards.text:
If you would draw a card, return a card from your graveyard to your hand instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.

rulings.text: It will replace itself being sent to the graveyard, and exile itself.
The second ability is a replacement effect, not a triggered ability. The card never gets to the graveyard.
The "if you can't" in the first ability refers to putting the card in your hand, as well as being unable to choose a card. Thus, if you can't choose a card during resolution, you lose the game.
If more than one card is being drawn due to a single effect, apply the replacement as if the cards were being drawn one at a time.

cards.originalText:
For each card you would draw, instead choose target card in your graveyard and put it into your hand. If you cannot, you lose the game.
Whenever a card is put into your graveyard, remove that card from the game.

cards.name: Forsaken Wastes
cards.text:
Players can't gain life.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 1 life.
Whenever Forsaken Wastes becomes the target of a spell, that spell's controller loses 5 life.

rulings.text: The loss of life from targeting this card does not work until after this card enters the battlefield, so you can counter it without losing life.
If a cost includes life gain (like Invigorate's alternative cost does), that cost can't be paid.
Effects that would replace gaining life with some other effect won't be able to do anything because it's impossible for players to gain life.
Effects that replace an event with gaining life (like Words of Worship's effect does) will end up replacing the event with nothing.

If an effect says to set your life total to a certain number, and that number is higher than your current life total, that effect will normally cause you to gain life equal to the difference. With Forsaken Wastes on the battlefield, that part of the effect won't do anything. (If the number is lower than your current life total, the effect will work as normal.)

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText:
Players cannot gain life.
During each player's upkeep, that player loses 1 life.
If Forsaken Wastes is the target of a successfully cast spell, that spell's caster loses 5 life.

cards.name: Grave Servitude
cards.text:
You may cast Grave Servitude as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-1 and is black.
cards.flavor:
"I no longer believe in a final resting place."
—Shauku, Endbringer

rulings.text: The color change lasts only while this card is on the creature.
The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Grave Servitude as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted creature gets +3/-1 and is black.

cards.name: Gravebane Zombie
cards.text: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.
cards.flavor:
"A zombie's bed must be a lumpy one or he wouldn't leave it so often."
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
cards.originalText: If Gravebane Zombie is put into the graveyard from play, put Gravebane Zombie on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Harbinger of Night
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.
cards.flavor:
Embrace the Harbinger
—Suq'Ata expression meaning
"abandon hope"
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.

cards.name: Infernal Contract
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
cards.flavor:
"But I signed nothing!"
—Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage

rulings.text: If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText: Pay half your life, rounded up: Draw four cards.

cards.name: Kaervek's Hex
cards.text: Kaervek's Hex deals 1 damage to each nonblack creature and an additional 1 damage to each green creature.
cards.flavor:
"If the curse does not strike you dead, question your soul."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: If a creature is both black and green, Kaervek's Hex will deal 1 damage to that creature.

cards.originalText: Kaervek's Hex deals 1 damage to each nonblack creature and an additional 1 damage to each green creature.

cards.name: Mire Shade
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mire Shade. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"We realized the bog had not given up a soul but had come to claim a new one."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a swamp: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mire Shade. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Nocturnal Raid
cards.text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The finest offering of night is not stealth but daring."
—Tetlok, Breathstealer

rulings.text: On resolution, all black creatures on the battlefield get the bonus. Ones that enter the battlefield later in the turn do not get it.

cards.originalText: All black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Painful Memories
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.
cards.flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael
cards.originalText: Look at target opponent's hand. Choose one of those cards and put it on top of his or her library.

cards.name: Phyrexian Tribute
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice two creatures.
Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"In your final breath you still have something to offer Phyrexia."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Sacrifice two creatures: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Purraj of Urborg
cards.text:
Purraj of Urborg has first strike as long as it's attacking.
Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {B}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Purraj of Urborg.
cards.originalText:
First strike when attacking
{B}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Purraj of Urborg. Use this ability only when a black spell is successfully cast and only once for each such spell.

cards.name: Ravenous Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a nonartifact creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Vampire. If you don't, tap Ravenous Vampire.
cards.flavor: Eternal life brings eternal hunger.
cards.originalText:
Flying
During your upkeep, sacrifice a nonartifact creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Vampire, or tap Ravenous Vampire.

cards.name: Reign of Terror
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures or all white creatures. They can't be regenerated. You lose 2 life for each creature that died this way.
cards.flavor:
"I don't know what takes them; they die around me without time to scream."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal
cards.originalText: Bury all white creatures or bury all green creatures. Lose 2 life for each creature put into the graveyard in this way.
